name: Chemical
author: Luminists JSL and HE
long_description:
The brush uses the Variational Quantum Eigensolver (VQE) to simulate simple molecules and drive changes on the canvas based on the resulting quantum states. 
 This is done by applying a preprocessed family of VQE circuits to different pixels of the canvas. The resulting quantum states are then mapped to color values, creating a dynamic and interactive painting experience that reflects the underlying quantum chemistry simulations. Therefore, by adjusting parameters such as bond distance and basis set, users can explore how different molecular configurations influence the visual effects produced by the brush.
 Available parameters include:
 - Radius: controls the size of the brush
 - Bond Distance: sets the interatomic distance for the simulated molecule
 - Basis: selects the basis set for the quantum simulation
 - Molecule: chooses the molecule to simulate (currently only H2 is supported).
